Hero.badge: Three layers to remove blank screens on CSR revisits
Hero.title: CSR revisits, restored instantly
Hero.subtitle: We save, sync, and roll back your last screen all at once.
Hero.bodyLine1: FirstTx is a toolkit built with Prepaint, Local-First, and Tx.
Hero.bodyLine2: Keep your CSR architecture while adding instant revisit recovery, offline resilience, and safe optimistic updates together.

HeaderRow.title: Prepaint + Local-First + Tx
HeaderRow.description: Start with what you need. Use Prepaint for revisit optimization, or add Local-First and Tx for sync and optimistic UI.

prepaint.name: Prepaint
prepaint.description: Save the last screen as a DOM snapshot and restore it in 0ms on the next visit.
points: Store full screen snapshot in IndexedDB
Restore instantly before React loads on revisits
Keep CSR structure with SSR-like revisit experience

localFirst.name: Local-First
localFirst.description: Keep IndexedDB as the single source and automate server sync.

tx.name: Tx
tx.description: Bundle UI updates into transactions to make optimistic updates safe.
points: Run multi-step updates as one transaction
Keep UI state consistent even on network errors

Experience.title: FirstTx from a user’s perspective
Experience.description: SSR helps first visits, but users spend more time revisiting, tabbing, and going back. FirstTx focuses on those moments so returning feels already-ready.

cards.title: Internal tools with frequent revisits
cards.description: Show the previous state immediately in CRM/admin/dashboard flows that bounce list → detail → list.

cards.title: Refreshing mid-task
cards.description: Local models keep the latest snapshot, so accidental refreshes preserve your working context.

cards.title: Handling failed optimistic UI
cards.description: Rollback happens per transaction, avoiding half-reverted screens when servers fail.

cards.title: Offline resilience
cards.description: A simple sync hook results in a data layer that tolerates offline/online transitions.

QuickStart.title: Start FirstTx with three lines
QuickStart.description: Most cases install all three packages. You can pick only Prepaint / Local-First / Tx as needed.
QuickStart.snippetTxDescription: Update UI before the request and safely roll back when it fails.
